definition: to reach an agreement/to agree upon
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: The premium rate of disproportional reinsurance by bilateral party agreed.
sentences.chinese: 非比例再保险的保险费率由双方当事人议定。

sentences.english: These amount to 5 percent against 1990 levels over the period from 2008 to 2012.The first phase of the protocol ends in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 该议定书的第一阶段于2012年结束。

sentences.english: Others claim Kyoto compliance by buying carbon credits.
sentences.chinese: 其他则通过购买碳信用额度的方式来遵守京东议定。

sentences.english: Those rights, as individual rights, can give rise to claims under the first Optional Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 可以据此根据第一项《任择议定书》提出的申请。

sentences.english: He must be too afraid to tell me what happened.
sentences.chinese: 他议定书太害怕了所以才不敢告诉我真囘相。

sentences.english: Chlorofluorocarbons were regulated under the Montreal Protocol starting in 1987.
sentences.chinese: 根据蒙特利尔议定书规定氯氟烃在1987年开始。

sentences.english: Developing protocols to better coordinate response operations in a third country.
sentences.chinese: 制定更好地在第三国协调应对行动的议定书草案。

sentences.english: From the text of a treaty agreed to entry into force, need many steps.
sentences.chinese: 一项条约从约文的议定到生效，经过许多步骤。

sentences.english: The US plan, if approved, could replace the existing Kyoto protocol.
sentences.chinese: 如果美国的计划被通过，那它将代替京都议定书。

sentences.english: Therefore, the electronic cigarette Australian rain through network marketing.
sentences.chinese: 所以澳雨电子烟都是议定网络直销的。

sentences.english: US petition drive towards ratifying the Kyoto Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 推进美国签署京都议定书的请愿书。

sentences.english: We disobey social protocol that stifles and stigmatizes personal freedom.
sentences.chinese: 我们服从社会和议定书，扼杀个人自由的烙印。

sentences.english: The Director General shall register this Act with the Secretariat of the United Nations.
sentences.chinese: 总干事应将本议定书交联合国秘书处登记。

sentences.english: We are going to over-achieve our Kyoto targets.
sentences.chinese: 我们将超越京都议定书的目标。

definition: to agree/to decide after consultation/to come to a compromise
to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
rules/regulations/constitution/statute/articles of association (of company)/articles of incorporation/charter (of a corporation)/by-laws
to discuss together/to try to reach a common judgment/panel discussion
to consult/to discuss seriously/to negotiate/to confer/negotiations/consultations
